intro: Bupleurum sprunerianum, commonly known as the Persian angelica, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Bupleurum sprunerianum is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
